Package camzup.core

Class Octree

java.lang.Object
camzup.core.Octree
public class Octree
extends java.lang.Object
Partitions space to improve collision and intersection tests. An octree node holds a list of points up to a given capacity; when that capacity is exceeded, the node is split into eight children nodes (octants) and its list of points is emptied into them. The octants are indexed in an array as follows: 
           **|-----|-----|
       ******|   6 |   7 |
   **********| FNW | FNE |
 |-----|-----|-----|-----|
 |   2 |   3 |   4 |   5 |
 | BNW | BNE | FSW | FSE |
 |-----|-----|-----|-----|
 |   0 |   1 |**********
 | BSW | BSE |******
 |-----|-----|**
forming a backwards z pattern.

  • Method Details

    • centersMean

      public Vec3[] centersMean()
      Finds the average centers for each leaf node of this octree.
      Returns:
      centers

    • centersMean

      public Vec3[] centersMean​(boolean includeEmpty)
      Finds the average centers for each leaf node of this octree. If the node is empty, and includeEmpty is true, then the center of the cell bounds is used instead.
      Parameters:
      includeEmpty - include empty cells
      Returns:
      centers

    • countLeaves

      public int countLeaves()
      Counts the number of leaves held by this octree. Returns 1 if this node is itself a leaf.
      Returns:
      the sum

    • countPoints

      public int countPoints()
      Counts the number of points held by this octree's leaf nodes.
      Returns:
      the sum

    • cull

      public boolean cull()
      Sets empty child nodes in the octree to null. Returns true if this octree node should be culled; i.e., all its children are null and it contains no points.
      Returns:
      the evaluation

    • getCapacity

      public int getCapacity()
      Gets the capacity of the node.
      Returns:
      the capacity

    • getLeaves

      public Octree[] getLeaves()
      Gets the leaf nodes of an octree as a flat array. The nodes are passed by reference, not by value.
      Returns:
      the octree array
      See Also:
      getLeaves(ArrayList)

    • getLevel

      public int getLevel()
      Gets the level, or depth, of the node.
      Returns:
      the level

    • getMaxLevel

      public int getMaxLevel()
      Gets the maximum level, or depth, of the node and its children.
      Returns:
      the level

    • getPoints

      public Vec3[] getPoints()
      Gets an array of points contained in this octree and its children. The points are transferred to the array by value, not reference, so changing them in the array will not change them within the tree.
      Returns:
      the points array
      See Also:
      getPoints(ArrayList)

    • insert

      public boolean insert​(Vec3 point)
      Inserts a point into the octree by reference. Returns true if the point was successfully inserted into the octree directly or indirectly through one of its children; returns false if the insertion was unsuccessful.
      Parameters:
      point - the point
      Returns:
      the insertion success
      See Also:
      Bounds3.contains(Bounds3, Vec3)

    • insertAll

      public boolean insertAll​(Vec3[] pts)
      Inserts points into the octree. Returns true if all insertions were successful; false if at least one was unsuccessful.
      Parameters:
      pts - the points
      Returns:
      the insertion success

    • isLeaf

      public boolean isLeaf()
      Evaluates whether this octree node has any children. Returns true if no; otherwise false.
      Returns:
      the evaluation

    • merge

      public Octree merge()
      If this octree node has children, converts it to a leaf node containing the centers of its children. Increases node capacity if necessary.
      Returns:
      this octree

    • queryRange

      public Vec3[] queryRange​(Bounds3 range)
      Queries the octree with a rectangular range, returning points inside the range.
      Parameters:
      range - the range
      Returns:
      the points.

    • queryRange

      public Vec3[] queryRange​(Vec3 center, float radius)
      Queries the octree with a spherical range, returning points inside the range.
      Parameters:
      center - the sphere center
      radius - the sphere radius
      Returns:
      the points.

    • reset

      public Octree reset()
      Resets this octree to an initial state, where its has no children and no points.
      Returns:
      this octree

    • setCapacity

      public void setCapacity​(int capacity)
      Sets the capacity of the node. If the node's point size exceeds the new capacity, the node is split.
      Parameters:
      capacity - the new capacity
      See Also:
      split()

    • subdivide

      public Octree subdivide()
      Subdivides this octree.
      Returns:
      this octree

    • subdivide

      public Octree subdivide​(int iterations)
      Subdivides this octree
      Parameters:
      iterations - iteration count
      Returns:
      this octree

    • subdivide

      public Octree subdivide​(int iterations, int childCapacity)
      Subdivides this octree. For cases where a minimum number of children nodes is desired, independent of point insertion. The result will be 8 raised to the power of iterations, e.g., 8, 64, 512, etc.
      Parameters:
      iterations - iteration count
      childCapacity - child capacity
      Returns:
      this octree
      See Also:
      split(int)

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Gets a string representation of this octree node.
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString​(int places)
      Gets a string representation of this octree node.
      Parameters:
      places - number of decimal places
      Returns:
      the string
